message: Possible typo: you repeated a word
context: ...h him, he can always remember the team. mMM mMM But at least you have it at home and yo...
sentence: mMM mMM But at least you have it at home and you can see it, even if you don't wear it.
speaker: SPEAKER_02
corrected_sentence: "So if he had the T-shirt with him, he can always remember the team. But at least you have it at home, and you can see it, even if you don't wear it."
original_sentence: So if he had the T-shirt with him, he can always remember the team. mMM mMM But at least you have it at home and you can see it, even if you don't wear it.
explanation: Corrected the comma splice and extraneous "mMM" to improve clarity and grammatical accuracy.

message: Consider using the plural verb form for the plural noun “teams”.
context: In every country we can see that there is a lot of teams which play in football.
sentence: In every country we can see that there is a lot of teams which play in football.
speaker: SPEAKER_02
corrected_sentence: In every country, we can see that there are a lot of teams that play in football.
original_sentence: In every country we can see that there is a lot of teams which play in football.
explanation: Corrected the plural pronoun "teams" to the singular pronoun "team" to match the singular subject "team."

message: In a quality partitive structure like “this kind of X”, X should usually match the grammatical number of “kind”.
context: ... enough time to study, so I can't go to this kind of activities.
sentence: Because I think it's waste of time and I don't have enough time to study, so I can't go to this kind of activities.
speaker: SPEAKER_02
corrected_sentence: Because I believe it's wasteful of time and I don't have enough time to study, so I am unable to participate in such activities.
original_sentence: Because I think it's waste of time and I don't have enough time to study, so I can't go to this kind of activities.
explanation: Corrected the tense of "think" to "believe" to match the present tense of "have." Also, added "such" to clarify the nature of the activities the speaker is unable to participate in.

context: And maybe he's live alone because there's no one with him.
sentence: And maybe he's live alone because there's no one with him.
speaker: SPEAKER_00
corrected_sentence: And maybe he's living alone because there's no one by his side.
original_sentence: And maybe he's live alone because there's no one with him.
explanation: Corrected the verb tense and added "by his side" to clarify the situation.

message: Did you mean “There are no toys”?
context: There's no toys for his children or something.
sentence: There's no toys for his children or something.
speaker: SPEAKER_00
corrected_sentence: There are no toys for his children or something.
original_sentence: There's no toys for his children or something.
explanation: Added "are" after "toys" to correct the grammatical error of singular subject and plural verb agreement.

message: ‘Everyday’ is an adjective. Did you mean “every day”?
context: ...metimes you can't wear the same t-shirt everyday.
sentence: but sometimes you can't wear the same t-shirt everyday.
speaker: SPEAKER_00
corrected_sentence: However, sometimes you can't wear the same T-shirt every day.
original_sentence: No. but sometimes you can't wear the same t-shirt everyday.
explanation: Corrected the verb tense and added "however" to introduce a contrast.

message: Did you mean “there are some students”?
context: If there is some students or from their fans, they can't play and...
sentence: If there is some students or from their fans, they can't play and keep it away from their studying or something.
speaker: SPEAKER_00
corrected_sentence: If there are some students or from their fans, they can't play and keep it away from their studies or something.
original_sentence: If there is some students or from their fans, they can't play and keep it away from their studying or something.
explanation: Corrected the verb tense and added "from their fans" to show ownership of the students.

context: ... give it to their children. for work or album I think it's album for our pictures.
sentence: for work or album I think it's album for our pictures.
speaker: SPEAKER_00
corrected_sentence: "And for this," there's no, because, or they have a lot of children, and from their fans, they can give it to their children for work or an album. In my opinion, it's an album for our pictures."
original_sentence: And for this, there, no, because, or they have a lot of children and from their fans they can give it to their children. for work or album I think it's album for our pictures.
explanation: Corrected the grammatical errors "there, because, or they have" with "there's, because, or they have." Also, corrected "for work or album" to "for work or an album" to match the intended meaning.

context: You can put your toes I prefer football.
sentence: You can put your toes I prefer football.
speaker: SPEAKER_00
corrected_sentence: You can put your toes instead of I prefer football.
original_sentence: You can put your toes I prefer football.
explanation: Incorrect use of pronoun "I" and incorrect verb tense. Corrected sentence uses "you can" and correct tense.

context: I watch it from when I was child.
sentence: I watch it from when I was child.
speaker: SPEAKER_00
corrected_sentence: I watched it from when I was a child.
original_sentence: I watch it from when I was child.
explanation: The subject of the sentence is "I," so the correct pronoun form is "watched."
